poem:
**Blackout Oil**

so much depends  
upon  

a tanker  
turning away  
from the island  

salt light  
in Havana  
goes out  

hospitals  
count breaths  
by candle  

a tariff—  
another wrench  
on the valve  

Mexico  
tries to pour  
solidarity  
without spilling  
itself  

and the sea  
keeps shining  
indifferent
